isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES: SPICER S100-S, S105-S, S135-S, S150-S - ASSEMBLE

step1.para: Press inner pinion bearing cone onto the pinion ( Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Press Inner Pinion Bearing Cone onto Pinion

step1.para: Press inner and outer bearing cups into the carrier until seated. Use a feeler gauge (.0015 inch approx.) to make sure that bearing cups are fully seated in bearing bores. Apply lubricant to both cup and cone.
Place carrier housing in press with the pinion supported by wood block (6 inches X 6 inches X 6 inches), so the inner pinion bearing is mated to the cone ( Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Place Carrier Housing in Press

step1.para: Insert original preload spacer and outer bearing onto pinion.
Press outer bearing onto pinion until completely seated.
Inspect end yoke or flange for grooves in seal surface caused by contaminants. If grooves can be detected, the end yoke must be replaced.
Use yoke installer service tool and install yoke without seal ( Figure 24).
Use torque multiplier and tighten pinion nut to 700 to 900 ft-lbs. (950 to 1,220 Nm).
Measure torque to rotate with an inch-pound torque wrench. Torque measurements should be taken every fourth revolution and should read between 10 and 40 in-lbs. of bearing preload ( Figure 25).

note.para: If bearing preload does not fall within allowed limits, preload can be increased by using a thinner spacer and decreased by using a thicker spacer. A .001 inch change in preload spacer thickness will change torque to rotate approximately 30 in-lbs.

step1.para: Pinion bearing preload spacers are available in the following thicknesses: .286 to .315 inch (7.26 to 8 mm).

note.para: Always measure each spacer before assembly to ensure correct thickness.
Closer adjustment can be made by sanding the next thicker spacer to desired thickness using emery cloth on a flat surface.

caution.para: Wash spacer thoroughly of emery cuttings before installing on pinion.

step1.para: Repeat process until torque to rotate is between 10 and 40 in-lbs. After proper preload is achieved, remove yoke and install new seal with proper service tool.
Install pinion oil seal with proper service tool. (Acceptable torque to rotate is 15 to 45 in-lbs. when pinion seal is installed.)
Install end yoke using yoke installer service tool ZTSE 4335 ( Figure 24).

note.para: Spicer recommends that new torque prevailing nuts be used.

step1.para: Use torque multiplier and torque pinion nut to 700 to 900 ft-lbs. (950 to 1,220 Nm).
